summary: Website for The Luminary International Music Competition (prestigious/professional). Winner performs at the Jane Elissa Extravaganza (annual Times Square NYC performance with Broadway stars). Site includes an application flow with video submission and a 75 CAD fee, plus FAQs and messaging that proceeds support leukemia and cancer research.
architectural_notes: Apply page should link out to external JotForm application URL (https://pci.jotform.com/form/260387196671063) and not include any internal form fields.
known_issues: User reports requested UI changes were not applied after deployment/build (homepage image/logo removal and Apply page link). Verify build pipeline/deploy and confirm updates are live.

existing_features.title: Create a professional, prestigious marketing website for a music competition for the “Jane Elissa Extravaganza” with clear messaging that the winner performs at an annual Times Square New York event with Broadway stars.

Implement a coherent visual theme that feels “super professional and prestigious” (e.g., refined typography, high-contrast palette such as charcoal/ivory with gold accents, generous spacing, formal layout) and apply it consistently across all pages.
Add an FAQs page (or dedicated FAQs section accessible from navigation) containing competition-related frequently asked questions and answers.
Add an “Apply” page with an application form that allows an applicant to either (a) upload a video file or (b) provide a YouTube video link, plus required applicant contact fields.
Collect a 75 CAD application fee as part of the application submission flow using an online payment step, and store the resulting payment status/details with the application record.
Add cause/impact messaging stating that funds raised through application fees go towards leukemia and cancer research.
Generate and include a small set of custom static brand images that reinforce a prestigious competition identity, and use them in the UI as static assets (not served via the backend).

Rename all user-facing competition branding from “Jane Elissa Extravaganza” to “The Luminary International Music Competition” across the site, while preserving messaging that the winner performs at the annual Jane Elissa Extravaganza Times Square New York event with Broadway stars.
Replace the homepage hero photo/image used at the top of the Home page with a new, more suitable hero image and update the hero image alt text to match the new competition branding.

On the Apply page, add a clearly labeled “Payment Method” section that explains the payment step and indicates supported payment methods via the hosted checkout flow, and ensure the form clearly supports submitting either a video upload OR a YouTube link (mutually exclusive) before proceeding to payment.

Remove the homepage hero photograph/image so the Home page no longer renders the hero (currently /assets/generated/hero-banner-v2.dim_1920x800.png) and the hero section uses a non-photographic background (e.g., solid color/gradient) while preserving the existing hero text and primary "Apply Now" call-to-action.

Remove the logo from the site header so the header no longer renders the logo (currently /assets/generated/competition-crest-logo.dim_512x512.png). Keep the site name text and navigation links intact and visually aligned without the image.

Update the Apply page to show ONLY an external link/button that opens the provided application form URL (https://pci.jotform.com/form/260387196671063). Remove/disable all internal application form fields and the payment/Stripe submission flow on this page.

Update the FAQs content on the FAQs page to reflect the latest submission instructions and 2026 competition timeline: (1) Under “How do I submit my performance?”, instruct users to go to the Apply page, tap the application link, and fill out the external form. (2) Under “What should my video include?”, update the suggested time limit to around 2–4 minutes. (3) Add/adjust FAQ content to state the application deadline is August 1st, 2026; winners will be announced via email on September 1st, 2026; and the performance will be mid November in Times Square.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a professional/prestigious marketing website for the music competition (core pages and branding)
Collect a 75 CAD application fee via online payment during application submission
Add cause/impact messaging that application fees fund leukemia and cancer research
Provide a backend query suitable for an internal/admin view to list submitted applications (most recent first), including key fields and payment status.
Rename the competition/website branding to “The Luminary International Music Competition”
Remove all photographs (including homepage hero image) and remove the site/logo from the header
On the Apply page, show ONLY an external application link/button to the provided JotForm (no embedded/internal form fields)

Update FAQs with submission instructions (Apply link), video time limit (2–4 minutes), deadline (Aug 1, 2026), winner announcement (Sep 1, 2026 via email), and performance timing/location (mid November in Times Square).
